title: Expected values of current through R3 and R4

content.question: Resistor Current <math alttext="in amps" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>A</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R sub 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> A person measures the current through some of the resistors in the circuit shown above. The data are shown in the table. Based on the data, what are the expected values of the current through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The currents through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="0.6 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="0.3 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>, respectively.

The currents through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="0.6 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="0.9 amp" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>9</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>, respectively.

The currents through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="1.8 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="1.5 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>, respectively.

The currents through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="1.8 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="2.1 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>, respectively.

content.answer: The currents through resistors <math alttext="R sub 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="R sub 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="1.8 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math> and <math alttext="1.5 amps" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>A</mtext></math>, respectively.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
